result.execSummary:
The defendant Durand A Greenlee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Durand A Greenlee in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Durand A Greenlee.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by:S.S. 
AS TO COUNT 1; 
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, concurrent to Count 2 . Credit for 7 days time served.
AS TO COUNT 2: 
Defendant sentenced to serve 3 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTON, concurrent to Count 1.
.
COURT ORDERS:
- defendant provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharges by 3-14-2024; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all mandatory courts costs, fees and surcharges by 3-14-2024; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent
-No contact with the victim.
.
Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant. -- gmb
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Durand A Greenlee in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appeared by video conference.  Case in court for a sentencing.  Defendant states he has tested positive for Covid and can't come into the building.  Court wants proof of positive test at the next court date.  Case is adjourned to 9-14-22 at 2:00 pm for sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Durand A Greenlee in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1 and 2:
  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to defendant's plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she and may not possess any firearms.

Case is adjourned to 8-11-22 at 2:00 pm for sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
